Name: Apples
Description: this crisp, aromatically-sweet apple features pink-orange stripes atop a pretty yellow background. Delicious in salads, pies, and sauces, the Galaâ€™s popularity is on the rise around the world.
Expiring Date: keep well for 1 to 2 months in the fridge.

Name: Basil
Description: The fragrant, sweet smell and peppery taste is key to making a great pesto as well as tomato-based pasta sauces.

Name: Sweet Corn
Description: GRILLING husked sweet corn directly on the flame caramelizes the sugar in the kernels and tightens their texture, particularly sugar-enhanced varieties.

Name: Garlic
Description: creamy cloves with a nutty, mild taste

Name: Wheat
Description: seeds could be stored for long periods in a dry climate, and can be used for bread

Name: Cherry Tomatoes
Description: small round tomato believed to be an intermediate genetic admixture between wild currant-type tomatoes and domesticated garden tomatoes. Cherry tomatoes range in size from a thumbtip up to the size of a golf ball, and can range from spherical to slightly oblong in shape.

Name: Black Beans
Description: shell-like appearance, black beans are, in fact, the edible seeds of the plant

Name: Rice
Description: Broken rice is used in brewing, distilling, and in the manufacture of starch and rice flour. Hulls are used for fuel, packing material, industrial grinding, fertilizer manufacture, and in the manufacture of an industrial chemical called furfural.

Name: Potatoes
Description: Fresh potatoes are baked, boiled, or fried and used in a staggering range of recipes

Name: Oats
Description: rolled or crushed into oatmeal, or ground into fine oat flour. Oatmeal is chiefly eaten as porridge, but may also be used in a variety of baked goods, such as oatcakes, oatmeal cookies and oat bread.

Name: Coconuts
Description: used primarily for the extraction of coconut oil for use in cooking. ... The seed is protected by a thick, stony shell, or endocarp, and is partially filled with a liquid known as coconut water.

Name: Mangoes
Description: The fruit is a drupe, with an outer flesh surrounding a stone.

Name: Strawberries
Description: soft, sweet, bright red berries. They're also delicious. Strawberries have tiny edible seeds, which grow all over their surface.

Name: Bananas
Description: curved, yellow fruit with a thick skin and soft sweet flesh.

Name: Plantains
Description: resembles a banana and is almost always cooked. ... Plantains are very starchy, green, and not as sweet as bananas.

Name: Coffee Beans
Description: It is the pit inside the red or purple fruit often referred to as a cherry. Just like ordinary cherries, the coffee fruit is also a so-called stone fruit.

Name: Grapes
Description: fleshy, rounded fruits that grow in clusters made up of many fruits of greenish, yellowish or purple skin.

Name: Olives
Description: subtropical broad-leaved evergreen tree (family Oleaceae) and its edible fruit

Name: Soybeans
Description: an erect bush with woody stems and alternately arranged leaves
